ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: It would be wonderful if we could meet more frequently in order to build a community among the PhD students. The programs are small, but a community atmosphere is lacking.

I'm not sure I remember what this course was--I think a few ethics events and another presentation or two. It's sad, because the PhD program seriously lacks cohesion and this course could be a good opportunity to create that. I know it's a work in progress, but we would really appreciate if developing a PhD group course was prioritized. We would love a journal club or chances to get together with people from other departments and talk with each other or faculty about careers, grad students life, and our fields.
A nice way to bring students together and hear interesting speakers
Great opportunity to share work and experience with peers. Certainly salient. More regular meeting times perhaps can enhance experience.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Christian Tschudi  Excellent, genuine, inviting, supportive.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Great opportunity to share work and experience with peers.
